fields.title: On the Soul
fields.content: The soul is the cause or source of the living body. That it is a cause in all three senses which we distinguishâ€”the source of motion, the end, and the essence.
fields.author: Aristotle

fields.title: Confessions, Book I
fields.content: Great are You, O Lord, and greatly to be praised; great is Your power, and of Your wisdom there is no end. And man, being a part of Your creation, desires to praise You.
fields.author: St. Augustine

fields.title: Summa Theologiae I, Q2, Article 3
fields.content: To prove the existence of God by way of motion: It is certain, and evident to our senses, that in the world some things are in motion. Whatever is moved is moved by another...
fields.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

fields.title: Five Proofs of the Existence of God (excerpt)
fields.content: The Aristotelian proof proceeds from the reality of change in the world to the existence of a purely actual actualizer. That which changes must be changed by another...
fields.author: Edward Feser

fields.title: The Republic, Book VII
fields.content: Behold! human beings living in a underground den, which has a mouth open towards the light... they see only their own shadows, or the shadows of one another...
fields.author: Plato

fields.title: The Consolation of Philosophy, Book I
fields.content: While I was silently pondering these things to myself and writing down my lamentations, I saw a woman standing over my head. Her eyes were full of fire, her presence full of authority...
fields.author: Boethius
